alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 05 at 1:17PM PST until March 06 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. * WHERE...Foothills of the Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest amounts of snow are expected in the western portions of the Foothills of the Southern Blue Mountain Foothills. Condon and Fossil are expected to get 3 to 4 inches of snow. Heppner is expected to get 1 to 2 inches of snow. Snow will be heaviest this evening and taper off after sunrise tomorrow morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon
